original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_I know that whatever God does is final. Nothing can be added to it_

_or taken from it. God's purpose is this that people should fear
Him._

(Ec. 3:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

So what is the purpose of life? It is that we should fear the
all-powerful

God. To FEAR God means to respect and stand in awe of Him because of

who He is. 'Purpose' in life starts with whom we know, NOT with what

we know or how good we are. It is IMPOSSIBLE to fulfill our God-given

purpose UNLESS we revere God and give Him first place in our life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You that everything was created by You with a
purpose.

I pray that you will forgive me for not living accordingly. I pray
that You

will forgive me for living selfishly and not thinking about the needs
of

others. Amen.
original_reflection_text: So what is the purpose of life? It is that we should fear the all-powerful God. To FEAR God means to respect and stand in awe of Him because of who He is. 'Purpose' in life starts with whom we know, NOT with what we know or how good we are. It is IMPOSSIBLE to fulfill our God-given purpose UNLESS we revere God and give Him first place in our life.
original_verse_text: I know that whatever God does is final. Nothing can be added to it or taken from it. God's purpose is this that people should fear Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that the fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. Help us to revere You, the all-powerful God, and to give You the rightful place in our lives. May our purpose be rooted in the knowledge of who You are, not in our own accomplishments. Guide us to live in awe of Your majesty and to submit to Your sovereign will. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: So what is the purpose of life? It is that we should fear the all-powerful God. To fear God means to respect and stand in awe of Him because of who He is. "Purpose" in life starts with whom we know, not with what we know or how good we are. It is impossible to fulfill our God-given purpose unless we revere God and give Him first place in our life.
subject: Revere the All-Powerful God
verse_text: I know that whatever God does is final. Nothing can be added to it or taken from it. God's purpose is this that people should fear Him.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY

_That which is, has already been, that which __IS __to be, already
has been;_

_and God seeks what has been driven away. _(Ec. 3:15)

_THOUGHT FOR TODAY:_

The complaining we often hear is: There is nothing new under the sun!

Lets not be negative today and focus on what God's Word says FOR
TODAY:

_"God seeks for what has been driven way. _The one searching for
meaning

in life, should read this verse again. To avoid a meaningless life
one needs

to seek a closer relationship with God, justification based on God's
favor

toward us is on account of Christ and received through faith in Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, prepare me for Your judgment through Your Word

and the marvelous news that You have already judged me as worthy of

eternal life through the death and resurrection of Your Son, our
Savior.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: The complaining we often hear is: There is nothing new under the sun! Lets not be negative today and focus on what God's Word says FOR TODAY: "God seeks for what has been driven way. The one searching for meaning in life, should read this verse again. To avoid a meaningless life one needs to seek a closer relationship with God, justification based on God's favor toward us is on account of Christ and received through faith in Him.
original_verse_text: That which is, has already been, that which IS to be, already has been; and God seeks what has been driven away.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that there is indeed nothing new under the sun. Yet, in Your infinite wisdom, You seek to restore what has been driven away, to give meaning to our lives. Through the gift of Your Son, Jesus Christ, we have been justified by faith and granted access to Your grace. Help us, Lord, to seek a closer relationship with You, that we may find true purpose and fulfillment in the life You have given us. May we walk in the light of Your love and grace, ever mindful of Your steadfast presence. Amen.
reflection: The complaining we often hear is: "There is nothing new under the sun!" Let's not be negative today and focus on what God's Word says for today: "God seeks for what has been driven away." The one searching for meaning in life should read this verse again. To avoid a meaningless life, one needs to seek a closer relationship with God. Justification based on God's favor toward us is on account of Christ and received through faith in Him.
subject: Seek Meaning in God's Favor
verse_text: That which is, has already been, that which IS to be, already has been; and God seeks what has been driven away.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_I also noticed that throughout the world th__ere is evil in the
courtroom,_

_Yes even the courts of law are corrupt! _(Ec. 3:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

I don't thing I have to remind you of this fact that there is evil
and corruption

in the place where there should be justice. It even affects the legal
system.

Solomon asked how God's plan can be perfect when there is so much
injustice

and oppression in the world (4:1). He concluded that God does not
ignore

injustice but will bring it to an end at His appointed time
(12:13,14).

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, we are seeing so much evil in our day. Because

of this, there are people who find it easy to not believe in You.
Help us

remember that this life is not all there is, so please forgive us
when we

pass judgment on You, because we do not know everything. Your plan

is to live with You forever, so help us to give thanks always. .
Amen.
original_reflection_text: I don't thing I have to remind you of this fact that there is evil and corruption in the place where there should be justice. It even affects the legal system. Solomon asked how God's plan can be perfect when there is so much injustice and oppression in the world (4:1). He concluded that God does not ignore injustice but will bring it to an end at His appointed time (12:13, 14).
original_verse_text: I also noticed that throughout the world there is evil in the courtroom, Yes even the courts of law are corrupt!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with heavy hearts, for we see the injustice and corruption that plague the world. Where there should be justice, we find evil and oppression. Lord, we know that Your plan is perfect, even when we cannot understand the depths of Your wisdom. Grant us the faith to trust in Your timing, for we know that You will ultimately bring an end to all unrighteousness. Give us the courage to stand for what is right and to be a voice for the voiceless. May Your kingdom come and Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Amen.
reflection: I don't think I have to remind you of this fact that there is evil and corruption in the place where there should be justice. It even affects the legal system. Solomon asked how God's plan can be perfect when there is so much injustice and oppression in the world (4:1). He concluded that God does not ignore injustice but will bring it to an end at His appointed time (12:13, 14).
subject: Overcoming Injustice and Oppression
verse_text: I also noticed that throughout the world there is evil in the courtroom, Yes even the courts of law are corrupt!

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_In due season God will judge everyone,_

_both good and bad, for all their deeds. _(Ec. 3:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Although God does not punish us immediately for our sins,

His eventual judgment is certain. We do not know exactly

when it will happen, but we know that no one will escape

the final encounter with the Creator.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, as I deal with the problems of

this life, I pray that Your Holy Spirit will guide me in

my faith so that I will never drift from my faith in You.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: Although God does not punish us immediately for our sins, His eventual judgment is certain. We do not know exactly when it will happen, but we know that no one will escape the final encounter with the Creator.
original_verse_text: In due season God will judge everyone, both good and bad, for all their deeds.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge that all people will one day stand before You for judgment. Help us to live with the awareness that our actions and choices have eternal consequences. Grant us the wisdom to repent of our sins and walk in obedience to Your will, so that we may be found righteous on that final day. May we be ever mindful of the brevity of life and the certainty of Your righteous judgment. Amen.
reflection: Although God does not punish us immediately for our sins, His eventual judgment is certain. We do not know exactly when it will happen, but we know that no one will escape the final encounter with the Creator.
subject: Certain Judgment Awaits All
verse_text: In due season God will judge everyone, both good and bad, for all their deeds.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_I realize that God allows people to continue in their sinful_

_ways so He can test them. That way, they can see for themselves _

_that they are no better than animals. _(Ec. 3:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon makes an observance of mankind that is very judgmental,

when he says mankind is no better then animals. But what do we hear

and see when watching the news. Remember Scripture tells we were

created as rational beings, BUT MANY have lost their true
rationality, and

so many are living irrationally, opposed to the righteousness of God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be mindful of the path You

want me to follow, I pray this in the name of Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Solomon makes an observance of mankind that is very judgmental, when he says mankind is no better then animals. But what do we hear and see when watching the news. Remember Scripture tells we were created as rational beings, BUT MANY have lost their true rationality, and so many are living irrationally, opposed to the righteousness of God.
original_verse_text: I realize that God allows people to continue in their sinful ways so He can test them. That way, they can see for themselves that they are no better than animals.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the truth of Your Word in Ecclesiastes 3:18. We confess that too often, we have lived irrationally, following the ways of the world rather than the path of righteousness. Help us to remember that we are created in Your image, endowed with the ability to reason and discern Your will. Grant us the wisdom to see beyond the deceptive ways of the foolish, as described in Proverbs 12:15. May we walk in the light of Your truth, ever mindful of our calling to live as Your children, bringing glory to Your name. Forgive us, Lord, and renew our minds, that we may be transformed by the power of Your Spirit, and live as faithful stewards of the rational faculties You have bestowed upon us. We pray this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: Solomon makes an observation of mankind that is very judgmental, when he says mankind is no better than animals. But what do we hear and see when watching the news? Remember, Scripture tells us we were created as rational beings, but many have lost their true rationality, and so many are living irrationally, opposed to the righteousness of God.
subject: Mankind's Irrational Existence Laments
verse_text: I realize that God allows people to continue in their sinful ways so He can test them. That way, they can see for themselves that they are no better than animals.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Solomon said _"I saw that there is nothing better for people than_

_to be happy in their work. That is why they are here! No one will_

_bring them back from death to enjoy life in the future."_

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Independent of God's revelation, we cannot know the future. Even

when we are called into the majesty of heaven, it is unlikely that

we shall see what is after us, but in the midst of eternal
blessedness,

would we really care?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, we have not kept Your Law as we should.We

continually sin and fear death. We know through Your Holy Gospel

by faith that all Your merits are ours freely through Christ. Death

cannot harm us, for it will be swallowed up in victory. Praise be to

You, O Lord. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Independent of God's revelation, we cannot know the future. Even when we are called into the majesty of heaven, it is unlikely that we shall see what is after us, but in the midst of eternal blessedness, would we really care?
original_verse_text: So I saw that there is nothing better for people than to be happy in their work. That is our lot in life. And no one can bring us back to see what happens after we die.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge that our ways are not our own, and that it is You who directs our steps (Proverbs 16:9). We confess that the future is unknown to us, and that we cannot see what will come after us (Ecclesiastes 3:22). Yet, we trust that in Your eternal presence, our earthly concerns will fade, and we will be filled with the joy of Your glory. Guide us, Lord, as we walk by faith, not by sight, until the day we are called home to dwell in Your eternal kingdom. Amen.
reflection: Independent of God's revelation, we cannot know the future. Even when we are called into the majesty of heaven, it is unlikely that we shall see what is after us, but in the midst of eternal blessedness, would we really care?
subject: Eternal Blessedness Transcends Future
verse_text: So I saw that there is nothing better for people than to be happy in their work. That is our lot in life. And no one can bring us back to see what happens after we die.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Solomon says; "_Then I observed that most people are motivated_

_to success by their envy of their neighbors. But this, too, is _

_meaningless, like chasing the wind" . _(Ec. 4:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The answer IS to work hard but with moderation. Take time to

enjoy the other gifts God has given, and realize that it is God

who gives out the assignments and the rewards, not us.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will always keep my focus

on Your plan for me that is provided in Scriptures. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The answer IS to work hard but with moderation. Take time to enjoy the other gifts God has given, and realize that it is God who gives out the assignments and the rewards, not us.
original_verse_text: Solomon says; "Then I observed that most people are motivated to success by their envy of their neighbors. But this, too, is meaningless, like chasing the wind".
prayer: Gracious Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our work and our accomplishments are ultimately in Your hands. Help us to find the right balance, not driven by envy or a relentless pursuit of success, but by a desire to faithfully steward the gifts You have given us. May we take time to enjoy the other blessings You have provided, trusting that You will guide our steps and reward our efforts according to Your perfect will. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The answer is to work hard but with moderation. Take time to enjoy the other gifts God has given, and realize that it is God who gives out the assignments and the rewards, not us.
subject: Balanced Approach to Work
verse_text: Solomon says; "Then I observed that most people are motivated to success by their envy of their neighbors. But this, too, is meaningless, like chasing the wind".

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_It is better to be a poor but wise youth then to be an old and _

_foolish king who refuses all advise. _(Ec. 4:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Advancement or getting to the top is meaningless. Position,

popularity, and prestige are poor goals for a life's work.

Although many seek them, they are shadows without substance.

How much better to seek God's approval. His love never changes.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my goal in life would

always meet with Your approval. .Amen.
original_reflection_text: Advancement or getting to the top is meaningless. Position, popularity, and prestige are poor goals for a life's work. Although many seek them, they are shadows without substance. How much better to seek God's approval. His love never changes.
original_verse_text: It is better to be a poor but wise youth then to be an old and foolish king who refuses all advise.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing that the pursuit of worldly advancement and status is ultimately empty and fleeting. Help us to resist the temptation of pride and arrogance, and instead seek Your approval and the eternal riches of Your love. May we find true fulfillment in walking humbly with You, and serving others with compassion and grace. Guide us, Lord, to live according to Your will, not the fleeting desires of this world. Amen.
reflection: Advancement or getting to the top is meaningless. Position, popularity, and prestige are poor goals for a life's work. Although many seek them, they are shadows without substance. How much better to seek God's approval. His love never changes.
subject: Seek God's Unchanging Love
verse_text: It is better to be a poor but wise youth then to be an old and foolish king who refuses all advise.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY: (The importance of fearing God)

_So when your make a promise to God, don't delay in following_

_through, for God takes no pleasure in fools. Keep all the promises_

_ you make to Him. _(Ec. 5 :4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon warns his readers about making foolish promises to God.

In Israelite culture, making vows was a serious matter. It is foolish

to make a vow you cannot keep or to play games with God by only

partially fulfilling your vow. (Pro. 20:25) It is better NOT TO vow

than to make a vow to God and break it. If you make a vow keep it.

(Mt. 5:33ff)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for hearing my prayers, help me

to remember the seriousness of making promises that I cannot keep

Amen.
original_reflection_text: Solomon warns his readers about making foolish promises to God. In Israelite culture, making vows was a serious matter. It is foolish to make a vow you cannot keep or to play games with God by only partially fulfilling your vow. (Proverbs 20:25) It is better NOT TO vow than to make a vow to God and break it. If you make a vow keep it. (Matthew 5:33ff)
original_verse_text: (The importance of fearing God) So when your make a promise to God, don't delay in following through, for God takes no pleasure in fools. Keep all the promises you make to Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with reverence, aware of the weight of the promises we make to You. Help us to be mindful and discerning, not rushing into vows that we cannot keep. May our words be few and our commitments steadfast, for You are a God of faithfulness who desires our wholehearted devotion. Grant us the wisdom to honor You with our actions, not just our words. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Solomon warns his readers about making foolish promises to God. In Israelite culture, making vows was a serious matter. It is foolish to make a vow you cannot keep or to play games with God by only partially fulfilling your vow. (Proverbs 20:25) It is better not to vow than to make a vow to God and break it. If you make a vow, keep it. (Matthew 5:33ff)
subject: Beware Foolish Vows to God
verse_text: (The importance of fearing God) So when your make a promise to God, don't delay in following through, for God takes no pleasure in fools. Keep all the promises you make to Him.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY: THE FUTURE DETERMINED AND UNKNOWN:

_Everything has already been decided. It was known long_

_ago what each person would be. So there is no use arguing _

what each person would be._ So there is no use arguing with _

_God about your destine._ (Ec. 5:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God knows and directs everything that happens, and He is in

complete control over our lives, even though at times it may

not seem like it. How foolish it is for us to contend with our

Creator, who knows us completely, and can see the future.

SEE (Ro. 9:19-23)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You for being in control even though at

times it seems hard to believe it. I pray that You will forgive

me for sometimes doubting You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God knows and directs everything that happens, and He is in complete control over our lives, even though at times it may not seem like it. How foolish it is for us to contend with our Creator, who knows us completely, and can see the future. SEE (Romans 9:19-23)
original_verse_text: THE FUTURE DETERMINED AND UNKNOWN: Everything has already been decided. It was known long ago what each person would be. So there is no use arguing what each person would be. So there is no use arguing with God about your destine.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your infinite wisdom and sovereignty. You alone know the beginning from the end, and Your ways are beyond our understanding. Forgive us for the times we have questioned Your plan or sought to satisfy our own desires, for You alone are worthy of our worship and trust. Help us to surrender our lives fully to Your perfect will, knowing that You work all things together for Your glory. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: God knows and directs everything that happens, and He is in complete control over our lives, even though at times it may not seem like it. How foolish it is for us to contend with our Creator, who knows us completely, and can see the future. (Romans 9:19-23)
subject: Sovereign God Directs All Things
verse_text: THE FUTURE DETERMINED AND UNKNOWN: Everything has already been decided. It was known long ago what each person would be. So there is no use arguing what each person would be. So there is no use arguing with God about your destine.
